item.title: Reading The File I Wrote(Part Of POH, Faster I Get helped, Faster Released)
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

Put it in a try / catch.

try {
  BufferedWriter in = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("filenamehere.txt"));
  while(true) {
    String line = in.readLine();
    if(line == null) break;
    //Do stuff with teh line here.
  }
} catch (IOException e) {
  System.out.println("OMG ERROR LULZ!");
}

Read full topic

client.java:27732: unreported exception java.io.FileNotFoundException; must be c
aught or declared to be thrown
BufferedReader br = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(“PlayerHouse/Stuff/”+playe
rName+".txt"));
^
client.java:27734: unreported exception java.io.IOException; must be caught or d
eclared to be thrown
String line = br.readLine();
^
Note: Some input files use or override a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
2 errors

item.title: Reading The File I Wrote(Part Of POH, Faster I Get helped, Faster Released)
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

No need.

[quote=“Documentation”]readLine

public String readLine() throws IOException

Read a line of text. A line is considered to be terminated by any one of a line feed (’\n’), a carriage return (’\r’), or a carriage return followed immediately by a linefeed.

Returns a String containing the contents of the line, not including any line-termination characters, or null if the end of the stream has been reached

Throws IOException - If an I/O error occurs[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Reading The File I Wrote(Part Of POH, Faster I Get helped, Faster Released)
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

[quote=“Aftermath_96, post:20, topic:42425”][quote author=Javacisnotrecognized link=topic=59265.msg726893#msg726893 date=1167799851]
BufferedReader & BufferedWriter are gay anyway. How about you just use regular FileWriter and FileReader? They’re easier to use.
[/quote]

Buffers are good.

BufferedWriter in = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("filenamehere.txt")); while(true) { String line = in.readLine(); if(line == null) break; //Do stuff with teh line here. }[/quote]

while(true) { String line = in.readLine(); if(line == null) continue; }
